text: Coombe Wood and The Lythe is a biological Site of Special Scientific Interest west of Bordon in Hampshire. It is part of East Hampshire Hangers Special Area of Conservation and Combe Wood is a National Trust property. This site has woods on Wealden Upper Greensand with a rich bryophyte flora and calcareous ground flora, especially green hellebore and violet helleborine. There are also meadows bordering a stream and an oak and hazel wood on Gault clay. ==References== Category:Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Hampshire
title: Coombe Wood and The Lythe
